verses.verse: «A Song of degrees.» When the LORD turned again the captivity of Zion, we were like them that Their deliverance was incredible and therefore took away all excuse for ingratitude. dream.

Then was our mouth He shows how the godly should rejoice when God gathers his Church or delivers it. filled with laughter, and our tongue with singing: then said they among the If the infidels confess God's wonderful work, the faithful can never show themselves sufficiently thankful. heathen, The LORD hath done great things for them.
The Lord hath done great things for vs, whereof we reioyce.
Turn again our captivity, O LORD, as the It is no more impossible for God to deliver his people than to cause the rivers to run in the wilderness and barren places. streams in the south.
They that sowe in teares, shall reape in ioy.

He that goeth forth and weepeth, bearing That is, seed which was scarce and dear: meaning, that they who trusted in God's promise to return had their desire. precious seed, shall doubtless come again with rejoicing, bringing his sheaves [with him].
